item.title: Grad students in (bio)statistics - do a postdoc!
item.description: Up until about 20 years ago, postdocs were scarce in Statistics. In contrast, during the same time period, it was rare for a Biology PhD to go straight into a tenure track position. Driven mostly by the availability of research funding for those working in applied areas, postdocs are becoming much more common in our field and I think this is great.Â It is great for PhD students to expand their horizons during two years in which they don’t have to worry about teaching, committee meetings, or grant writing.
